article.title: Probing star formation and feedback in dwarf galaxies. Integral field view of the blue compact galaxy Tololo 1937-423

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the continuum intensity map of Tololo 1937-423 reveal about its structure?
choices: The intensity is uniformly distributed across the galaxy.
The intensity peaks sharply in multiple distinct regions.
The intensity increases steeply towards the inner part of the galaxy, with a single peak.
The intensity is concentrated in filament-like structures extending from the galaxy center.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the overall distribution pattern of the warm ionized gas in Tololo 1937-423, as revealed by the Ha emission-line map?
choices: Smooth and centrally concentrated, similar to the continuum emission.
Irregular and patchy, with no clear structure.
Concentrated in a single, dominant knot of star formation.
Distributed along an axis with multiple distinct knots of star formation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the Ha/HÎ² line-ratio map of Tololo 1937-423 indicate about its interstellar extinction pattern?
choices: The extinction is uniformly distributed across the galaxy.
The extinction is highest in the outer regions of the galaxy.
The extinction is concentrated exclusively within the star-forming knots.
The extinction is inhomogeneous, with the maximum situated roughly at the position of the continuum peak.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the ages derived for the different star-forming knots in Tololo 1937-423, based on their Ha equivalent widths and evolutionary synthesis models, suggest about the star formation history of this galaxy?
choices: All star-forming regions have similar ages, indicating a single, synchronized burst of star formation.
Younger knots are found at larger galactocentric distances, while older knots are closer to the continuum peak, suggesting a possible triggered star formation scenario.
The ages of the knots are randomly distributed, with no clear pattern.
The derived ages are unreliable due to the significant uncertainties associated with this method.
